title: Stock Futures, Bond Yields Rise Ahead of Jobs Report
sub_head: The health of the labor market is a key factor in Federal Reserve decisions over how fast to raise interest rates
body:
Stocks were poised for muted gains and bond yields rose to start the second quarter as investors awaited employment data to gauge the health of the labor market.
Futures for the S&P 500 edged up 0.5% Friday, a day after the benchmark stocks gauge closed out its biggest quarterly decline since the start of 2020, falling about 5% for the first three months of the year. Futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average also rose 0.5%, and contracts for the technology-focused Nasdaq-100 added 0.6%.
